textBox.richText: Maps can be standard political or physical representations, or they can be illustrative of things like population or which people use what kind of birth control. They are above all, critical reference points for students. I have put here as many good map resources as I could find, including blank political maps, scans of very old maps, and creative representations of things like the small arms trade. You can find these sources here: Links for Maps & Geography. I am also working on adjusting the formatting of the resources page, Teaching. More is being added to Links for Student-Friendly Sites each day as well. Please let me know if you have any comments about the formatting, or any resources that I should add or pull. Thank you for your help! Since this is a one-woman operation, I need all the input I can get.
